result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shayla L Porter Brawner

records.addlTxt:
3:46 PM Defendant Shayla L Porter Brawner not in court.  Attorney Daniel P. Murray in court for Shayla L Porter Brawner.  Prosecuting attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense filed a letter about 1 hour before hearing today, requesting another plea/sentencing hearing, and requests that any capias issued by the Court be stayed. 

State does not object to a stayed capias. 

Court will issue a capias, but stay it, to the next hearing. Defense requests to set for plea/sentencing hearing. Court sets.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 26, 2023 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 26, 2023 at 10:30 am.
Letter dated 10/27/2022, filed by Atty Murray, request remote appearance or adjournment of 10/27/2022 Plea and Sentencing

Plea/sentencing hearing on October 27, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Reset due to court conflict.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 19, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Defendant waives her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:44 AM Defendant Shayla L Porter Brawner appeared by Zoom.  Attorney Daniel P. Murray in court for Shayla L Porter Brawner. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. 

The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. 
Waive reading of Information. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Hearing on August 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

09:29 AM Defendant Shayla L Porter Brawner not in court.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Daniel Murray appearing in court.  Atty. Murray does not know why the defendant is not here and she thought she would be appearing by zoom.  State requests a capias and bond revoked.  Atty. Murray requests an adjournment.  Court ordered a warrant stayed until next court date.  Defendant can appear by zoom for the next court date.  9:34 Defendant appears in court.  Atty. Murray requests an adjournment.  Court withdraws capias. Defendant can appear by zoom at the next hearing if she has a device to appear by zoom.  Hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Request for defendant to appear by zoom
  **Reviewed by Commissioner Martin Binn on 07-29-2022. "Atty Murray and defendant may appear via Zoom"
Preliminary hearing on July 29, 2022 at 09:15 am.

12:59 PM Defendant Shayla L Porter Brawner appeared by Zoom video but unable to connect to her audio with attorney Daniel P. Murray who appeared by Zoom.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Clerk's letter to defendant regarding court-appointed attorney.
Signed by Commissioner David Herring on June 7th, 2022.
Hearing on June 10, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

**Reviewed by Commissioner David Herring on 6/7/2022 - The defendant is indigent for the purposes of representation, request granted. Defendant to pay $75.00 per month, with the first payment due on 7/1/2022.**
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with victims A & B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.   Defendant not to use or possess any personal identifying information other than their own, including financial transaction cards.

02:05 PM Defendant Shayla L Porter Brawner in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court quashes the warrant.
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.     Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  The Defendant given the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel paperwork in court.
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
THE COURT AUTHORIZES ZOOM FOR NEXT HEARING.  Hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
EXT CODE 3.

11:05 AM Defendant Shayla L Porter Brawner not in court.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

State motions the Court to issue a warrant for the defendant.
The Court will issue a $100.00 arrest warrant.
EXT CODE 3.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key, signed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on May 10th, 2022.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
